response: Hello there! Please type in a keyword or phrase that best describes the reason for your visit today.

The TEST light means it’s time to test. Blow into the device when prompted.
A VIOLATION means you missed a test or failed one. Call your provider for help.
An ABORT means the breath wasn’t strong or steady enough, or the camera couldn’t see the device. Relax, reposition, and try again.
A LOCKOUT means multiple fails or missed service. You’ll need to wait it out or call for an override if it’s permanent.
A FAIL means alcohol was detected. Rinse with water, wait 5 minutes, and avoid using mouthwash or anything with alcohol before testing.
Make sure the handset is 18–24 inches from the camera and the target sticker is fully visible. Wave it gently if needed.
The SERVICE light means you’re due for your appointment. Call ahead if you need to reschedule to avoid early recall or lockout.
If you’re asked for a retest while driving, pull over safely. You have a few minutes to take it before a violation gets recorded.
Blow steadily while humming “DO” or “DAA.” You’ll hear a tone if you’re doing it right. Keep it smooth, not too soft or too hard.
Some products like mouthwash or cold meds contain alcohol and can trigger a FAIL. Wait 5–15 mins after use before testing.
To check if you're eligible for early reinstatement, contact the Colorado DMV at 303-205-5613 or visit their site. You'll also need an interlock installed.
You'll need to request an SR-22 certificate from your insurance company to begin the license reinstatement process.
You'll need to complete forms DR2598, DR2870, and DR2058. These are available at Colorado.gov and must be submitted to the DMV.
Call LifeSafer at 855-527-1597 to schedule your installation. Ask about discounts while you're on the line!
Once your forms are ready, bring them and the $95 fee to the Colorado Department of Revenue.
Depending on your case, you may need to complete alcohol treatment classes and provide proof of enrollment.
You cannot drive during your 30-day suspension period. Violating this can seriously delay your reinstatement.
Hi Robyn, have a great day today. Take charge and make it a good one! Tell Kevin, Alyssa, and Derek I said hello!
